WorkItem.Description:
I was just curious about getting an installer file (MSI or something like that). I would love to start testing this on Codeweavers Crossover for Mac, but since it doesn't have an installer, Crossover can't take the Rawr.exe and make a .APP out of it. I know I could use Mono, but it tends to hang my MBP, and booting into VMWare is not very efficient since it takes way too much memory and CPU time. 
Â 
Thanks,

Comments.Message: There's no installer for Rawr, because nothing needs to be installed. There's a way to load a folder in CrossOver, I did it before. It's something like you choose an 'Other' option in the app installer window of CrossOver, and select the unzipped Rawr folder.

They have since changed that so that it only works if there is an installer, and won't just take a folder like Rawr and make a .APP out of it.

I realize there isn't anything to actually be installed... but can't an installer be made that will just unpack the folder in order to fool CrossOver?
Shouldn't be too difficult for anyone to build an installer from the source code. I just don't have time at the moment, really low priority.
